instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3320: What is 820-3320? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no audio
threads.message: Hi, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3320</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no audio on speakers or earphones. Prohibition symbol on audio when trying to change volume. Mic isn't working either. No signs of water damage. No chime.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no audio
threads.message:
Any history available?
Is the audio codec recognized in System Report?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no audio
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no audio
threads.message:
Check all power rails of <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>.
Start checking <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> output.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no audio
threads.message: Done, <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> was ripped from its pads. Thank you very much.
